meanings.sent1: She was coequating the weights of the two boxes to ensure they were the same.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was coequating the scores of all students to ensure fairness.
meanings.sent3: The chef was coequating the ingredients in the recipe, making sure nothing was left out.
meanings.sent4: The artist was coequating light and shadow in the painting to create a sense of balance.
meanings.sent5: The scientist was coequating the variables in the experiment to achieve accurate results.

meanings.definition: To bring into a state of equality or equivalence.
meanings.sent1: The mediator was coequating the conflicting parties to find a middle ground.
meanings.sent2: The manager was coequating the workload among team members for a fair distribution.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were coequating their share of the cake, making sure each got an equal piece.
meanings.sent4: The conductor was coequating the instruments in the orchestra to create harmonious music.
meanings.sent5: The negotiator was coequating the terms of the contract to satisfy both parties.
